After several tests and variations it still doesn't work ...

It's really annoying that callbacks functions are not called. Really the sendData callback function should be called when the controlTransfer is submitted, no ? but on test it's just never called. Is the control transfer really done ? mystery ...

Also if I get it well there are no really listener in USB. Device can talk only when asked to. This means that once the control transfer is done, i should perform an interrupt transfer on my data endpoint, the 0x81, with a data buffer of 32 bytes but how exactly can i specify the device to send back data with that ? i read about the direction token so is that the first byte of data on interrupt that should have a specific value, indicating the device to effectively write on this buffer and send back data ?
title: USB error 9 during control transfer
